fund.title: Fund
fund.description:
Diversify your capital across hundreds of cryptocurrencies. 
1. Create a fund by percentage allocating capital to crypto assets that meet your strategy.
2. Attract investors to your fund and earn commissions
3. Track and manage your fund by re-allocating assets.

self-managed-fund.title: Self-managed Fund
self-managed-fund.description: Create your own portfolio with crypto assets that match your strategy. You can change its entire structure at any time. Self-managed Funds are private so you cannot attract investor capital. All re-allocation history, profits and losses are kept private. You can always change your fund to Public to attract investment.

program.title: Program
program.description:
Programs are similar to PAMM accounts. 
1. Create a program and raise capital for ongoing trading by attracting investors.
2. Trade using the assets under management (AUM) and earn profit. Any profits generated will be divided among all participants who have joined your program.
3. Set your own commissions and receive a percentage of the investors' profit.

trading-account.title: Trading account
trading-account.description: Create a trading account and get access to a variety of instruments (depending on your desired broker.) Trade Forex, Crypto, CFD, Stocks, Metals, Indices and Commodities.

attach-external-account.title: Attach external account
attach-external-account.description: Add your Binance account to the platform to copy trades opened and managed by another trader, while having complete control over your capital. You can also make your account a signal provider at any time.

kyc-limit.text-3: Deposit and withdraw crypto without limits
kyc-limit.text-6: Create Programs (with a maximum investment amount equivalent to $1,000) and Funds
kyc-limit.text-7: Bind your external trading account and use copy trading functionality (Follow)
kyc-limit.text-8: Invest in Programs and Funds up to $1,000 in total
kyc-limit.text-9: After you pass KYC you also can:
kyc-limit.text-11: Invest in Programs and Funds without limits
kyc-limit.text-12: Attract investments in your Programs beyond the KYC limit
kyc-limit.text-13:
Note
 KYC is an authentication mechanism required in the financial industry to help ensure companies are compliant with anti money laundering regulations.

total.total-balance: Current market value of your assets on the platform.
total.invested: Current market value of your investments in programs, funds, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions and including pending requests.
total.trading: Current market value of your investments in your programs, funds and trading accounts, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions.
total.performance: The change of your profit on the platform: day, week, and month.

trading.your-equity: Current market value of your investments in your programs, funds and trading accounts, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions.
trading.aum: Assets under management (AUM) is the total market value of the investments that you currently have under managment in programs and funds from investors.
trading.total: Current market value of your investments in your programs, funds and trading accounts, and assets under management (AUM)
trading.login: Login from the trading account for the program.
trading.equity-fund: Current market value of your assets in this fund.
trading.ddown-fund: Maximum drawdown of the fund during the selected date range.
trading.leverage: Set leverage of the trading account. Trading with leverage allows the trader to open positions larger than their own capital.
trading.trades: Number of trades the manager has executed during the selected date range.

investing.balance: Current market value of your investments in programs and funds, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions and including pending requests.
investing.programs: Number of programs you have invested in.
investing.funds: Number of funds you have invested in.
investing.size: Current market value of your assets in the fund
investing.investors: Number of investors in the fund
investing.ddown: Maximum drawdown of the program during the selected date range.
investing.profit: Profit or loss resulting from the manager trading. This is calculated according to your share of investment in the program.
investing.value: Current market value of your investment in the program, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions.
investing.equity: Current market value of investments in the program, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions.
investing.assets: Number of assets to have invested in.

private-card.equity: Current amount of funds in the trading account, taking into account the profit/loss of open positions.
private-card.leverage: Set leverage of the trading account. Trading with leverage allows the trader to open positions larger than their own capital.

others.refund: Amount of funds that have been returned to your wallet.

investing.most-profitable: The most profitable Programs and Funds
investing.title: Investments
